content: There’s a bus service that runs from Sheffield railway station, almost past my house, and on out into the Derbyshire Peak District to the small town of Bakewell. Going one way or the other the bus diverts to call at Chatsworth House, a stately home (actually, a palace….). Somehow that trip to Chatsworth has got onto young Chinese students’ tourist guidebooks, and the bus is often full of Chinese students long before it gets to where I live and I can’t get on. But that’s OK — we just wait for the next one. And here’s something really cool — the bus company has installed a system on (some of) these buses that makes announcements in mandarin, because the drivers certainly don’t speak mandarin and not many of these students speak English. Mandarin announcements on a bus in Yorkshire — now that’s what I call an unexpected result.
